title: Induced current in loop near wire

content.question: A circular wire loop is placed near a long, straight, current-carrying wire in which the current is either increasing or decreasing. In which of the following situations is the induced current in the loop counterclockwise?

choices.label: An illustration shows a circular wire loop placed above a straight horizontal wire. An arrowhead is marked on the straight wire facing rightward and labeled, “I increasing.”
An illustration shows a circular wire loop placed to the left of a straight horizontal wire. An arrowhead is marked on the straight wire facing upward and labeled, “I increasing.”
An illustration shows a circular wire loop placed below a straight horizontal wire. An arrowhead is marked on the straight wire facing leftward and labeled, “I decreasing.”
An illustration shows a circular wire loop placed to the right of a straight horizontal wire. An arrowhead is marked on the straight wire facing upward and labeled, “I decreasing.”
An illustration shows a circular wire loop placed above a straight horizontal wire. An arrowhead is marked on the straight wire facing leftward and labeled, “I decreasing.”

content.answer: An illustration shows a circular wire loop placed below a straight horizontal wire. An arrowhead is marked on the straight wire facing leftward and labeled, “I decreasing.”
